title: 1999年David Bowie : 無論好與壞，網絡對社會嘅影響將會超乎想象，係興奮同恐怖之間，好似外星人落咗地球咁

replies.msg:
David Bowie當年對網絡出現嘅睇法，今日發生緊...

"internet is going to do to society, both good and bad, is unimaginable"

今日（1月8號）係已過世David Bowie 74歲嘅生日，1999年佢接受BBC訪問講對internet呢樣嘢嘅睇法，上一代藝人（遠東國際城市嗰啲更加唔好比，就無咁多傷害）有幾多個有咁嘅洞察力？

"I think that, we, at the time up until at least the mid 70s, really felt that we were still living under the guise of a single and absolute created society where there were known truths and known lies and there was no kind of duplicity or pluralism about things that we believed in."
（我覺得由好耐之前到七十年代中，我地係活响單一同絕對嘅社會，世事只有已知嘅對與錯，對所信嘅嘢無任何多樣性或者詭辯嘅餘地。）

"That started to break down rapidly in the 70s and the ideas of a duality in the way that we live. There are always two, three, four, five sides to every question. The singularity disappeared and that I believe, has produced such a medium as the internet which absolutely establishes and shows us that we are living in total fragmentation."
（七十年代之後，單一概念打破晒，然後每件事都可以有五六個答案，而網絡就响呢個環境建立，話比大家知已經進入完全碎片化嘅時代。）

"I don’t think we’ve even seen the tip of the iceberg. I think the potential of what the internet is going to do to society, both good and bad, is unimaginable. I think we’re actually on the cusp of something exhilarating and terrifying!"
（無論好與壞，網絡對社會嘅影響將會超乎想象，係興奮同恐怖之間，我地依家連最面嘅影響都未見到呀。）

"It’s an alien lifeform…yes it’s just landed here!"
（基本上係外星物種，啱啱降落地球。）
#廿年後今日都仲係啱啱開始
